name: Shibuya
description: The beating heart of modern Tokyo. Start at the famous scramble crossing, go up Shibuya Sky for sunset views, shop in 109 and Parco.

name: Shinjuku
description: Tokyo's biggest station area. East side is neon entertainment (Kabukicho), west side is skyscrapers. Don't miss Memory Lane yakitori.

name: Asakusa
description: Old-world Tokyo at its best. Walk through Kaminarimon gate, snack on Nakamise-dori, and feel the history. Great Skytree views from the river.

name: Harajuku & Omotesando
description: Takeshita Street is pure sensory overload — crepes, arcades, and wild fashion. Walk to tree-lined Omotesando for a calmer vibe.

name: Akihabara
description: Otaku heaven! Multi-floor arcades, retro game shops (Super Potato!), anime figure stores, and maid cafes. Dad and kid paradise.

name: Ginza
description: Tokyo's most upscale district. Even if you don't shop luxury, the architecture and department store food halls are worth a visit.

name: Odaiba
description: Man-made island with futuristic vibes. Take the Yurikamome monorail for bay views. Great half-day with kids.

name: Ikebukuro
description: Less touristy alternative to Akihabara for anime/manga. Sunshine City complex has the Pokemon Center, aquarium, and more.

name: Ueno
description: Cultural district with Tokyo's best museums. Ueno Park for cherry blossoms, Ameyoko market for street food and bargains.

name: Hakone
vibe: Mountain retreat, hot springs, Mt Fuji views
description: Day trip from Tokyo (90 min by train). Do the Hakone Loop: train → cable car → ropeway → pirate ship → bus. Mt Fuji views on clear days.

name: Shuzenji
vibe: Historic onsen town, bamboo groves, ryokan
description: Charming hot spring town in Izu Peninsula (~2h from Tokyo via Shinkansen+Izuhakone Railway). Ancient temple, bamboo-lined paths, riverside onsen. Our ryokan night is here Mar 18-19!
